bib.title: Convince a dozen more and succeed--the influence in multi-layered social networks
bib.author: Michalski, Radoslaw and Kazienko, Przemyslaw and Jankowski, Jaroslaw
bib.abstract: Humans utilise multiple communication channels in their social interactions and also information diffusion as well as the spread of influence are practically related with many contexts. Each such context (channel) may represent a different communication method or a different environment of a given person. This facilitates building multiple social networks, that are not independent. They share the same set of nodes connected with many links grounded on different layers-these networks are called multi-layered or multiplex social
bib.booktitle: 2013 International Conference on Signal-Image Technology \& Internet-Based Systems
